metadata.title: CVE-2018-5748 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
qemu/qemu_monitor.c in libvirt allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice (memory consumption) via a large QEMU reply.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5748` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu2').
